intro: Psephellus zangezuri, commonly known as the Zangezur bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in mountainous areas with well-drained soil, thriving in temperate climates. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
